t: 1 Chronicles 1
From Adam to Abraham
Adam,*ln Seth, Enosh,
Kenan,*ln Mahalalel, Jared,
Enoch,*ln Methuselah, Lamech,
Noah,*ln Noah’s sons: Shem,*ln Ham, and Japheth.
Japheth’s*ln sons: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
Gomer’s*ln sons: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
Javan’s*ln sons: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
Ham’s*ln sons: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Cush’s*ln sons: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabteca. Raama’s*ln sons: Sheba and Dedan.
Cush*ln fathered Nimrod, who was the first to become a great warrior on earth.
Mizraim*ln fathered the people of Lud, Anam, Lehab, Naphtuh,
Pathrus, Casluh (the Philistines came from them), and Caphtor.
Canaan*ln fathered Sidon as his firstborn and Heth,
as well as the Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
Arvadites, Zemarites, and Hamathites.
Shem’s*ln sons: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
Arpachshad*ln fathered Shelah, and Shelah fathered Eber.
Two sons were born to Eber. One of them was named Peleg because the earth was divided during his lifetime, and the name of his brother was Joktan.
Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All of these were Joktan’s sons.
Shem,*ln Arpachshad, Shelah,
Eber,*ln Peleg, Reu,
Serug,*ln Nahor, Terah,
and*ln Abram (that is, Abraham).
Abraham’s Descendants
Abraham’s*ln sons: Isaac and Ishmael.
These*ln are their family records: Nebaioth, Ishmael’s firstborn, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These*ln were Ishmael’s sons.
The*ln sons born to Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. Jokshan’s*ln sons: Sheba and Dedan.
Midian’s*ln sons: Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All*ln of these were Keturah’s descendants.
Abraham*ln fathered Isaac. Isaac’s*ln sons: Esau and Israel.
Esau’s*ln sons: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
Eliphaz’s*ln sons: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, and Kenaz; and by Timna, Amalek.
Reuel’s*ln sons: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
The Edomites
Seir’s*ln sons: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
Lotan’s*ln sons: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
Shobal’s*ln sons: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. Zibeon’s*ln sons: Aiah and Anah.
Anah’s*ln son: Dishon. Dishon’s*ln sons: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
Ezer’s*ln sons: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. Dishan’s*ln sons: Uz and Aran.
These*ln were the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before*ln any king reigned over the Israelites: Bela*ln son of Beor. Bela’s*ln town was named Dinhabah.
When*ln Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place.
When*ln Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
When*ln Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the territory of Moab, reigned in his place. Hadad’s*ln town was named Avith.
When*ln Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.
When*ln Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates River reigned in his place.
When*ln Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place.
When*ln Baal-hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place. Hadad’s*ln city was named Pai, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter*ln of Matred, daughter of Me-zahab.
Then*ln Hadad died. Edom’s*ln chiefs: Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
Magdiel, and Iram. These*ln were Edom’s chiefs.
